description:
This setting governs whether Direct Memory Access (DMA) capable devices are allowed to access system memory while the computer is locked or in standby/sleep mode.

Direct Memory Access (DMA) is a capability that allows certain hardware (e.g., external PCIe devices, Thunderbolt peripherals) to read/write directly to system memory without going through the CPU.

This policy directly influences system I/O performance and security posture, especially when using high-speed ports (Thunderbolt, USB4, PCIe expansion cards).
name: BHC - Windows - Security Baseline Data Protection
